snippet: The shooting rampage in Orlando is one case in a familiar pattern where concerns about a person’s behavior are raised, but have not yet been addressed in court.
abstract: Weapons Sales column; Orlando, Fla, nightclub gunman Omar Mateen was able to legally purchase guns despite signs he was psychologically unstable; gun control proponents are hoping to force  Republican lawmakers, who cite right to due process in opposing restricted access to guns, to face renewed pressure to consider exceptions on mental health grounds.

byline.contributor: David Herszenhorn and Eric Lichtblau contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The shooting rampage in Orlando is one case in a familiar pattern where concerns about a person’s behavior are raised, but have not yet been addressed in court.

headline.main: Orlando Aftermath: Red Flags, Yet Legally Able to Buy a Gun
headline.print_headline: Another Killer Who Could Buy His Guns Legally, Despite the Red Flags
